newsitem.title: USA: US ag attache--96/97 S. Africa corn crop 8.5 MMT.
newsitem.headline: US ag attache--96/97 S. Africa corn crop 8.5 MMT.

text.p: A U.S. agricultural attache pegged the South Africa 1996/97 corn crop at 8.5 million tonnes, unchanged from a previous estimate, despite dry weather.
In a report dated April 2 that was released in Washington Monday, the attache said good rains in March followed two very hot, dry weeks in February that caused damage to the crops.

"At this stage it is more a shortage of sunlight and heat that is limiting the potential of the fast maturing corn crop," the attache wrote. "The situation is still uncertain and presently it is not necessary to change our 8.5 million (metric) ton estimate," the attache wrote.
Attache reports are not official USDA data.

In its latest World Supply and Demand report on March 11, the U.S. Agriculture Department forecast South Africa 1996/97 corn crop at 8.5 million tonnes, down by one million tonnes from the prior month's estimate.
